comments.body: @bocklund, are you ok with being a maintainer on the `pycalphad` recipe in [conda-forge](http://conda-forge.github.io/)?

I am happy to be a maintainer for pycalphad.

Thank you,

Brandon Bocklund
brandonbocklund@gmail.com

> On Aug 8, 2016, at 8:44 PM, jakirkham notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In recipes/pycalphad/meta.yaml https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/1195#discussion_r73982122:
> 
> > -    - pycalphad.core
> > -    - pycalphad.io
> > -    - pycalphad.plot
> >   +
> >   +about:
> > -  home: https://pycalphad.org/
> > -  license: MIT
> > -  summary: 'CALPHAD tools for designing thermodynamic models, calculating phase diagrams and investigating phase equilibria.'
> > -  doc_url: https://docs.pycalphad.org/
> > -  dev_url: https://github.com/pycalphad/pycalphad
> >   +
> >   +extra:
> > -  recipe-maintainers:
> > -    # Always check with the people listed below if they are OK becoming maintainers of the recipe. (There will be spam!)
> > -    - richardotis
> > -    - bocklund
> >   @bocklund https://github.com/bocklund, are you ok with being a maintainer on the pycalphad recipe in conda-forge http://conda-forge.github.io/?
>

What is the reason for not using this particular version?
